intro: Candollea juncea, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Candollea juncea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
